intro: Conceveiba ovata, commonly known as the ovalleaf conceveiba, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded areas. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
